context: The Estonian word 'pime' has multiple related meanings: 1) As an adjective, it means 'dark' referring to lack of light (Õues on pime - It's dark outside); 2) As an adjective, it can mean 'blind' when describing a person with no vision (Ta isa oli pime - His father was blind); 3) As a noun, it refers to darkness or the state of being blind (Väljas valitses täielik pime - Complete darkness ruled outside). The word has various extended figurative meanings including 'ignorant,' 'reckless,' 'gloomy,' and others depending on context. It can also be used in colloquial expressions to express surprise or emphasis.
